New Records: Angel Di Maria is tied with Gonzalo Higuain for the fifth-most goals in Argentina's history with 31 goals, and is just four scores behind Diego Maradona at No. 4 on the leaderboard.
Key Match Events: Angel Di Maria scored a goal in the 40th minute to open the scoring for Argentina.
Lionel Messi made his long-awaited return to international football, coming on in the 56th minute and replacing Angel Di Maria.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina head coach Lionel Scaloni said that he decided to sit Messi for the first half to take care of him and have him arrive in optimal conditions for the Copa America.
Scaloni emphasized the importance of competing and adding minutes for the team before the Copa America.
Post-Match Reflections: Scaloni said that the goal is to continue competing and that these guys have competing in their blood, and that sometimes it turns out well and other times it doesn’t turn out well, but you have to keep playing.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina, the reigning World Cup and Copa America champions, haven’t lost in their last seven meetings with Ecuador, a streak dating back to 2019.
Others: Argentina will wrap up their pre-Copa America slate in Washington D.C. on Friday with a warm-up match against Guatemala before opening their group stage of the tournament against Canada on June 20.
Ecuador has a pair of international friendly matches remaining against Bolivia on Wednesday and Honduras on June 16 before opening the Copa America schedule against Venezuela on June 22.
